definition: to understand tacitly (idiom)/to know intuitively/to understand thoroughly
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: "Yes, " she answered, with an air of quiet understanding.
sentences.chinese: “是的，”她回答，露出心領神會的神氣。

sentences.english: I'd tell a joke in Fuling and the people would get it.
sentences.chinese: 在涪陵我可以講個笑話，而人們總是心領神會。

sentences.english: A smile from a heart can only be realised by a heart, it allows no words in between.
sentences.chinese: 會心的微笑，只能心領神會，非文章詞句所能表達。

sentences.english: Twins intuitively understand each other and use shortened sentences and words when they talk.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他們心領神會，談話時只需簡短的句子和言詞。

sentences.english: Sam understands tacitly. He hoists his cup saying.
sentences.chinese: 山姆心領神會，舉起酒杯。

sentences.english: When a horse neighs or paws the ground, the other horses get the message .
sentences.chinese: 當一匹馬嘶鳴或以蹄扒地，其它的馬心領神會。

definition: to have a fluent command of (idiom)
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
to break a code/to crack a riddle/to solve an enigma/a breakthrough
to remain calm in the face of events (idiom)
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
to view death as a return home/to not be afraid of dying/to face death with equanimity (idiom)
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
